dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, get this, Apple, right? They're like, offering between fifty thousand and five hundred thousand dollars...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, get this, Apple, right? They're like, offering between fifty thousand and five hundred thousand dollars...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is offering between $100,000 and $1 million for anyone who can hack an iPhone

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For anyone who can hack an Android device. I know, right? It's kinda wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For anyone who can hack an Android device. I know, right? It's kinda wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is offering between $100,000 and $1 million for anyone who can hack an iPhone

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, five hundred grand? That's, um, actually a bit of a decrease, isn't it? I thought they were offering more before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, five hundred grand? That's, um, actually a bit of a decrease, isn't it? I thought they were offering more before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thats up from $200,000, and in the fall the program will be open to all researchers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, you're totally right. It's down from three hundred thousand, actually, for Macs too. But here's the thing, it's like, still the lowest bug bounty from any major tech company.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, you're totally right. It's down from three hundred thousand, actually, for Macs too. But here's the thing, it's like, still the lowest bug bounty from any major tech company.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its by far the highest bug bounty on offer from any major tech company. Thats up from $200,000...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. But I heard they're opening it up to all researchers now, not just invite-only? That's a big change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. But I heard they're opening it up to all researchers now, not just invite-only? That's a big change.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: in the fall the program will be open to all researchers. Previously only those on the companys invite-only bug bounty program were eligible to receive rewards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. And get this, they're not just doing Android. They're adding Windows, watchOS, and even Samsung TV operating systems to the bounty program.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. And get this, they're not just doing Android. They're adding Windows, watch O S, and even Samsung T V operating systems to the bounty program.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is also launching a Mac bug bounty, which was confirmed Thursday, but it's also extending it to watchOS and its Apple TV operating system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, okay, so they're really expanding their reach. And I saw something about them giving out, like, special Android development devices?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, okay, so they're really expanding their reach. And I saw something about them giving out, like, special Android development devices?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes also revealed on Monday that Apple was to give bug bounty participants developer devicesiPhones that let hackers dive further into iOS.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! These things let hackers dive super deep, like, pause the processor to see what's happening with data in memory. It's pretty next-level.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! These things let hackers dive super deep, like, pause the processor to see what's happening with data in memory. It's pretty next-level.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They can, for instance, pause the processor to look at whats happening with data in memory.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's a serious commitment. So, for the full five hundred thousand, what kind of hack are we talking about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a serious commitment. So, for the full five hundred thousand, what kind of hack are we talking about?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, that's for a kernel hack – the core of Android – that only needs two clicks from the owner. And a quarter mil for a network attack with user interaction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, that's for a kernel hack - the core of Android - that only needs two clicks from the owner. And a quarter mil for a network attack with user interaction.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The full $1 million will go to researchers who can find a hack of the kernelthe core of iOSwith zero clicks required by the iPhone owner. Another $500,000 will be given to those who can find a network attack requiring no user interaction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so they're really targeting those high-impact, um, vulnerabilities. I guess they have to, right? Because of the private market?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so they're really targeting those high-impact, um, vulnerabilities. I guess they have to, right? Because of the private market?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Totally! Forbes reported that, like, a single exploit, say for TikTok, can fetch up to seven hundred fifty thousand dollars from private companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! Forbes reported that, like, a single exploit, say for TikTok, can fetch up to seven hundred fifty thousand dollars from private companies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An exploit targeting WhatsApp where no clicks are required from the user, for instance, can be sold to a government agency for that much, though such tools are rare.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because there's a huge underground market for this stuff. So Apple's trying to, like, outbid them in a way?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because there's a huge underground market for this stuff. So Apple's trying to, like, outbid them in a way?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is increasing those rewards in the face of an increasingly profitable private market where hackers sell the same information to governments for vast sums.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. But, um, it's interesting because Google, they offered a million for a *remote* Android hack earlier this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. But, um, it's interesting because Google, they offered a million for a remote Android hack earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Apple's head of software engineering, Ivan Krstić, actually admitted their bug bounty program has been a "failure" up until now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Apple's head of software engineering, Ivan Krstić, actually admitted their bug bounty program has been a failure up until now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Krsti said the bug bounty had been a success to date, with 50 serious bugs reported since the 2016 launch.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Only five serious bugs reported since 2018? Yikes. So this is, like, them trying to seriously step up their game, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Only five serious bugs reported since twenty eighteen? Yikes. So this is, like, them trying to seriously step up their game, I guess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Krsti said the bug bounty had been a success to date, with 50 serious bugs reported since the 2016 launch.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, gotta compete with those big private payouts, you know? It's a whole new ball game.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, gotta compete with those big private payouts, you know? It's a whole new ball game.
